subject: Investing
title: Tracking and Monitoring Your Dividends
description: A quick, practical guide to Tracking and Monitoring Your Dividends.

hook.text: An investor missed a dividend cut because she never checked her brokerage statements. Three months of lost income gone.

buildup.text: Tracking dividends means monitoring payment dates, amounts, yield changes, and payout ratio trends for each holding.

discovery.text: Free tools and apps let you build a dividend calendar showing exactly when each payment arrives.

twist.text: A sudden dividend freeze or cut is often the first warning sign of deeper financial trouble at a company.

climax.text: Review your dividend portfolio quarterly: check coverage ratios, growth rates, and upcoming ex-dates.

punchline.text: You manage what you measure. Track your dividends like the income stream they are.

quiz.question: Why is tracking dividend payments important?
options: It helps you spot cuts or freezes that signal trouble
